mdRecord.dcterms:title: Military Instructions, Stephen Hopkins to Col. Christopher Harris, 1755 June 14
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Hopkins, Stephen, 1707-1785
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Stephen Hopkins, Governor of Rhode Island and signer of the Declaration of Independence, writes to Christopher Harris during the French and Indian War, ordering a Colonel to take forces to Albany and join Major General William Johnson for a campaign against the French at Crown Point. Autograph document signed, 2 pages.
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: United States -- History -- French and Indian War, 1754-1763
